name: Meg
description: Content to work behind the scenes with her trusty mecha suit, Meg takes care of real problems, while Max and Surge are out entertaining the crowds.

gadgets.name: Jolting Volts
gadgets.description: Heal the Mecha by 518 health per second for 5 seconds.

gadgets.name: Toolbox
gadgets.description: Meg drops her toolbox, which increases the reload speed for nearby allies by 35% until it gets destroyed.

starpowers.name: Force Field
starpowers.description: Meg is protected by a 25% shield for 10 seconds when her Mecha is destroyed.

starpowers.name: Heavy Metal
starpowers.description: Upon expiring, the Mecha suit explodes dealing 2400 damage to nearby opponents and pushing them away.

tips: Meg is a reliable damage dealer in her Mecha, so it is best utilized to deal damage to the Heist safe or to pressure the enemy in Duels. However, her reload speed as well as movement speed is decreased in her Mecha. Because of this, it’s better not to chase down enemies in Bounty or Knockout.

Meg is an agile poker without her Mecha because of her fast movement speed and fast unload speed, but with it, she becomes a devastating fighter and control asset as she can deal high damage in large areas with her attack and secondary Super.

There's a slight delay before Meg hops into her Mecha, and her Super can be cancelled if she dies, gets knocked back, or gets stunned. Make sure to activate her Super where you'll be safe from attacking enemies.

In Brawl Ball, Meg can be very viable as a defense to oncoming opponents with the ball as her Mecha has a lot of health and can be used to significantly damage opponents. She can take enemy fire and provide some area denial to help the ball carrier score an easy goal.

In Showdown, Meg can be a force to be reckoned with due to her starting in her much stronger Mecha form. Combined with her Jolting Volts Gadget, Meg can duel even longer range Brawlers due to the Mecha's high health. However, Meg becomes much weaker after it is destroyed. Prioritize picking up Power Cubes and use her Force Field Star Power to increase Meg's survivability outside her Mecha.

When the various upgrades the Mecha gives Meg are needed more than usual, using Meg's Jolting Volts Gadget can keep Meg in her Mecha significantly longer against long range Brawlers that can prevent it from healing. This is useful in Heist because Meg will have a very low impact on the health of the Safe in her standard form, but can deal substantial damage onto the safe when inside her Mecha.
Be mindful when taking on high-responsibility roles such as the Gem carrier in Gem Grab or the ball carrier in Brawl Ball, because if Meg's Mecha is taken out, she will become an easy target.

Avoid close combat and engaging with aggressive Brawlers after her Mecha is destroyed. Either Star Power can help by shielding some damage or pushing away enemies near Meg, but those won't completely save her from taking damage or being defeated.
Meg's advanced Super will cancel its main attack. Keep this in mind if you want to deal substantial long-range damage.

history.description: Meg was added to the game.
Meg's Super is now lost if she is defeated while activating her Super.
Meg now spawns with no ammo after her Mecha is destroyed (from 3).
Meg now takes longer to start healing after her Mecha is destroyed.
Fixed a bug where Meg's face texture would disappear when in her Mecha.
Meg's Self Destruction Star Power was added.
Meg now spawns with 1 ammo after her Mecha is destroyed (from 0).
Meg's second Star Power was renamed to Heavy Metal (from Self Destruction).
Fixed an issue where Meg could use a teleporter again after activating her Super.
Meg's Heavy Metal Star Power damage was increased to 1500 (from 1000).
The number of hits necessary to charge Meg's Super was increased to 8 hits (from 6).
Fixed a bug where Meg visually spawns as her Mecha after respawning.
Fixed an issue where destroying Meg's Mecha could crash the game.
The Beetle Meg skin was added. It was featured as a Biodome skin.
Meg's Toolbox Gadget was added.
Meg's True Silver and True Gold skins were added.
The Monster Truck Meg skin was added. It was featured as a Stunt Show skin.
Meg's main attack and Super visual effects were slightly reworked.
The number of hits necessary to charge Meg's Super was decreased to 7 hits (from 8).
Meg's health was increased to 2300 while in her base form (from 2200).
Meg and Monster Truck Meg's main attack visual effects were reworked.

Meg's flavor text was changed from "Meg has a basic form and an advanced form where she hops inside her trusted Mecha. The Mecha loses health over time and has low healing ability. Destroying the Mecha returns Meg to her basic form." to "Meg has a basic form and an advanced form where she hops inside her trusted Mecha suit. The suit gradually loses health, returning Meg to her basic form when the Mecha suit is destroyed."
Meg's class was changed to Tank (from Damage Dealer).
The health decay mechanic from the Mecha was removed.
Meg’s Mecha can now regenerate health over time.
Meg's Mecha no longer receives reduced healing from outside healing sources.
Meg's Mecha health was decreased to 4000 (from 5000).
Meg's Mecha main attack damage was decreased to 210 (from 240) per bolt.
Meg's Mecha Super damage decreased to 1700 (from 2400).
The number of hits necessary to charge Meg's Super was increased to 8 hits while in her base form (from 7).
Meg now respawns with her Mecha.
Meg's Mecha Super was changed to require 11 hits to charge (from charging automatically over 5 seconds).
The Jaguar Spirit Meg skin was added. It was featured as a Power League exclusive skin for Brawl Pass Season 18.
Meg's Force Field Star Power damage reduction was decreased to 25% (from 35%).
Meg's Force Field Star Power duration was decreased to 10 seconds (from 30).
Meg's Mecha health was decreased to 3700 (from 4000).
Meg's Jolting Volts Gadget healing was decreased to 300 (from 450) per second.

Meg's flavor text was changed from "Meg has a basic form and an advanced form where she hops inside her trusted Mecha suit. The suit gradually loses health, returning Meg to her basic form when the Mecha suit is destroyed." to "Meg starts the game inside her trusty Mecha suit. Meg returns to her basic form when the Mecha suit is destroyed, but can use her super to get back into it."
The Megalodon skin was added. It was featured as a Cursed Pirates skin.
All Brawlers' health and damage were increased from 5% to 10% with each Power Level.
Fixed an issue with Megalodon's losing animation.
Meg's Jolting Volts Gadget healing was increased to 415 (from 300) per second and now scales with Power Levels.
Meg's Heavy Metal Star Power damage was increased to 2160 (from 1500) and now scales with Power Levels.

Meg's flavor text was changed from "Meg starts the game inside her trusty Mecha suit. Meg returns to her basic form when the Mecha suit is destroyed, but can use her super to get back into it." to "Content to work behind the scenes with her trusty mecha suit, Meg takes care of real problems, while Max and Surge are out entertaining the crowds."

stats.reload: 1.3 seconds (Very Fast), 0.845 seconds (with Toolbox), 1.5 seconds (Mecha; Normal), 0.975 seconds (Mecha; with Toolbox)
